Ad Text:
Hello. We‚Äôre Virgin Australia. We‚Äôre the airline that‚Äôs always done things a little different. Our way. The Virgin way. We‚Äôre on a mission to make flying better than ‚Äònice‚Äô. And to do that, it takes a team of talented people who are passionate about customer experience, doing the right thing always, with a focus on safety ‚Äì in the air, on the ground and in our workplaces. A team who values real diversity and inclusion, in a big brand with big ambitions.

What you‚Äôll be doing:

You‚Äôll be at the forefront of shaping how AI transforms our business. In this role, you‚Äôll take ideas from concept to reality partnering with stakeholders to uncover opportunities designing intelligent systems that solve complex problems and building solutions that scale. From architecting non-deterministic systems to crafting the ‚Äúlast mile‚Äù of data science and engineering, you‚Äôll work across the full stack and lifecycle. You‚Äôll also lead the integration and operation of advanced AI models, including LLMs and agents, ensuring they deliver real impact in commercial environments.¬†

You‚Äôll be great in this role if you:

Hold a Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering or Data Science or have equivalent applied experience
Have completed AI systems design courses or specialisations (e.g., deeplearning.ai, fast.ai)
Bring 5+ years of experience designing, building and operating production-grade AI systems
Have 2+ years of experience leading engineering teams
Delivered hands on solutions with LLMs and agentic systems (RAG, tool/function calling, planning)
Implemented MLOps/LLMOps practices: CI/CD for models/prompts, registries, automated evaluations, observability
Worked cross functionally with Product, Engineering, Security, Legal/Privacy and Operations teams.
Are fluent in Python and frameworks like FastAPI / FastMCP
Have experience with LangGraph / LangChain, Databricks, pgvector, and AWS Cognitive Search (or equivalents)
Understand advanced RAG techniques, retrieval strategies, context packing, tool orchestration, safety/guardrails
Know observability practices (metrics, logs, traces) and security/privacy fundamentals (IAM, secrets, network isolation, PII handling)
Thrive in Agile delivery environments owning roadmaps, estimation and stakeholder communication across technical and executive audiences

It‚Äôs even better if you also:

Hold certifications in AWS, Databricks, Kubernetes, Terraform/IaC, security or Responsible AI
Have deployed AI solutions on AWS and Databricks (including MLflow/Mosaic)
Bring experience in airline/travel operations or high-growth tech environments
Understand optimisation, operations research, reinforcement learning or simulation
Are familiar with React, TypeScript, experimentation platforms, A/B testing and causal inference at scale
Know FinOps strategies for managing model/LLM usage efficiently
Understand agent-based architectures, embeddings and vector databases
Apply MLOps/LLMOps patterns like CI/CD, registries, automated evaluations and canary/shadow deployments
Have knowledge of AWS cloud concepts for secure, scalable AI workloads
Follow software engineering best practices: testing strategies, CI/CD, code health, design reviews
Understand modern data lakehouse patterns and event-streaming concepts
Stay informed on Responsible AI, safety patterns, model governance and privacy law/data residency considerations

What you‚Äôll get from us:

We‚Äôre committed to looking after you, with some of the best benefits and conditions in the industry ‚Äì including (but not limited to):

Heavily discounted air travel for you and your loved ones (including $1000 worth of travel credits per year)
Flexible working arrangements (including work hours and work from home)
Discounts on travel insurance, car hire, accommodation and experiences worldwide
Discounted Virgin Australia Lounge membership
Hospitality, retail, technology, beauty services and wellness discounts
Wellness support, including the Converge digital wellbeing platform
A comprehensive Employee Assistance Program, which offers confidential coaching and support from qualified professionals for all aspects of life ‚Äì physical, mental, social and financial
Dress for Your Day ‚Äì enjoy the freedom to wear whatever is appropriate for the type of work you do and the day you have ahead of you

Equality rules:

We‚Äôre all individuals. We love that. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those from diverse cultural backgrounds, our friends in the LGBTQIA+ community, and anyone else who wants to join our family.

Ready to apply? We‚Äôre ready to hear from you. Apply now.

Ignite is Australia's preferred partner in recruitment and technology solutions across private and public sectors.

We‚Äôre looking for a strategic and hands on AI Technical Leader to drive the design, development, and deployment of advanced AI and machine learning solutions across our organisation. This role is central to shaping our AI strategy, setting technical direction, and leading a team of engineers and data scientists in delivering scalable, production grade solutions.

You‚Äôll play a pivotal role in guiding the implementation of Azure AI services, Databricks, and modern MLOps practices to support high-impact use cases across the business. This is a leadership role for someone who thrives at the intersection of AI innovation, engineering excellence, and practical business outcomes.

¬†

¬†

Day to day:¬†

Lead the end-to-end design and delivery of AI/ML solutions using Azure AI ecosystem (e.g. Azure Machine Learning, Azure OpenAI, Azure Functions, AI Foundry) and Databricks
Act as the technical SME across AI initiatives, ensuring best practices in architecture, code quality, scalability, and performance
Define and drive the roadmap for AI use cases in alignment with business strategy and stakeholder needs.
Manage and mentor a team of AI engineers, ML ops specialists, and data scientists
Establish robust MLOps pipelines, data versioning, model deployment strategies, and governance frameworks using tools such as Azure DevOps
Collaborate closely with data platform, BI, and automation teams to integrate AI seamlessly into broader business solutions
Ensure solutions comply with data privacy, ethical AI, and enterprise security standards
Provide architectural oversight and review of AI workloads running on Azure Databricks, Spark, and Delta Lake.
Evaluate and experiment with emerging LLMs, embeddings, and generative AI capabilities, and lead their application in production use cases

¬†

¬†

You'll be perfect for the role if you have:¬†

5+ years of experience in software engineering, data science, or AI-focused roles, with at least 2 years in a technical leadership or architect capacity
Proven track record delivering AI/ML solutions in a cloud-native Azure environment
Deep experience with Databricks, Spark, Delta Lake, and MLflow
Strong programming skills in Python
Hands-on knowledge of Azure tools such as:
Azure Machine Learning
Azure OpenAI Service
Cognitive Services
Azure Databricks
AI Foundry
Azure DevOps
Experience with LLMs, embedding models, prompt engineering, vector search and integrating AI into apps via APIs or copilots
Excellent stakeholder engagement skills ‚Äì ability to translate business needs into AI solutions with measurable outcomes
Familiarity with data governance, privacy (e.g. GDPR), and responsible AI frameworks

¬†

¬†

Build your future with Makita Australia!

Location: Pemulwuy Sydney, NSW
Full-time | Permanent Role | Great Company Perks

Makita is transforming its data and analytics capability and we‚Äôre looking for a hands-on Full-Stack Data Engineer to lead the development of our new enterprise data platform. This is a rare greenfield opportunity where you‚Äôll design, build, and optimise end-to-end solutions that support smarter decision-making across the business.

About Makita (Australia)

Makita Corporation was founded in 1915 as an electric motor sales and repair company who in 1958 became the first company in Japan to manufacture electric planers. Now, over 100 years on we have a reputation as the world leading manufacturer of power tool products for the Building & Construction, Power Garden and Commercial Cleaning industries.

What You‚Äôll Do

Build a modern data warehouse and replace legacy reporting systems.

Develop Power BI dashboards, KPI frameworks, and automated reporting.

Design and maintain ETL/ELT pipelines across ERP, finance, operations & more.

Ensure data security, integrity, and governance.

Work closely with Finance, Supply Chain, Sales, Customer Service & Operations.

Support ERP upgrades and evaluate AI/ML opportunities.

Why You‚Äôll Love It

Opportunity to shape future data strategy and grow a team.

Work with modern tools, cloud platforms, and flexible architecture.

A global, trusted brand known for quality and innovation.

Stable, long-term career opportunity with room to grow.

What We‚Äôre Looking For

3‚Äì5 years‚Äô experience in data engineering or BI development.

Strong SQL & Python skills.

Experience with modern data platforms (Snowflake, Redshift, Synapse, etc.).

Skilled in Power BI (or Tableau/Qlik).

Experience with AWS, Azure, or GCP data services.

Excellent communication and ability to translate business needs into solutions.

Nice to Have

Azure Data Engineer (DP-203), Power BI PL-300, or similar certifications.

Exposure to AI/ML for predictive analytics or automation.

Culture

At Makita, we value our culture and the way we work together to deliver results. Our success is due to the quality of our products, the high calibre of our people and the commitment to providing exceptional customer service.

What's in it for you?

Staff discounts on Makita products (yes, even the ones you‚Äôve had your eye on!)

Birthday leave (take the day off it‚Äôs your special day!)

Paid parental leave and access to employee assistance program (EAP)

Anniversary recognition and referral bonuses

Recruitment Process and Privacy Policy

Successful candidates will be required¬†to complete pre-employment checks such as reference checks, NPC, driving history and a pre-employment medical which includes a drug/alcohol test in line with Makita's policies and procedures.

All personal information received by us from you or about you will be stored, used and disclosed by us in accordance with our privacy policy, a copy of which can be found at www.makita.com.au/Company/privacy-policy.

To all recruitment agencies:¬†Makita does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Makita employees or any other company location. Makita is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Company: Talent ‚Äì Specialists in tech, transformation & beyond
Ad Text:
Founding Engineer - North Sydney (Onsite, 5 days/week)

Talent International is partnering with a leading, hyper-growth AI company to hire their next Founding Engineer.

Role Snapshot

Role Title: Founding Engineer

Contract Length: Permanent (salary open depending on experience)

Location + WFH Flexibility: North Sydney, 5 days onsite

Salary: Open & highly competitive (includes top-of-market equity)

Project: Building and scaling next-generation AI consumer products

Client Industry: AI / Consumer Tech

Start Date: ASAP

Interview Process:

* Coffee chat

* 1-hour system design interview

* Short paid work trial

* Offer (top of market + equity)

About the Opportunity

We're working with one of Australia's most exciting AI product companies - one of the fastest-growing consumer AI apps globally, hitting 10M+ users in under a year with a team of only 12. They're profitable, bootstrapped, and scaling at Silicon Valley speed.

This is a rare chance to join as one of the first five engineers, working directly with repeat founders and an elite engineering team in North Sydney.

What You'll Be Doing

You'll build across the full stack, own problems end-to-end, and ship at extreme speed. Expect to work directly with the CTO on bleeding-edge AI challenges.

Examples of what you might ship

Real-time AI video calling with <200ms latency
GPU orchestration for millions of image generations per day
Testing/optimising in-house models and LoRAs for 10-100M users
Full feature ownership: user understanding ‚Üí idea ‚Üí build ‚Üí ship ‚Üí iterate

Tech Stack: TypeScript, Next.js, React, TailwindCSS, tRPC, Postgres, Temporal

Who They're Looking For

They hire only exceptional engineers.

Extremely smart, rapid learner
Full-stack builder who ships fast
High agency and low ego
Works well in an intense, fast-paced, talent-dense environment
Someone who builds outside of work (side projects, OSS, niche tools, competitions)
Comfortable working onsite 5+ days per week
Comfortable that some customer segments operate in the adult industry

Why This Role Is Exceptional

Opportunity

Top 50 global AI consumer app in <12 months
Possibly the fastest-growing bootstrapped startup in Australia
Profitable with strong revenue-no VC pressure
Salary above market + meaningful equity

Technology

Real AI infrastructure (not API wrappers)
Running their own GPUs, custom training, and rapid scaling
Millions of images/messages generated daily
Exposure to cutting-edge tools like Temporal and Planetscale

Team

Repeat founders with previous multimillion-dollar exit
Ex-VC, ex-CTO, founders newly returned from SF
Team of 12 doing the work of what's usually 30-50 engineers
No silos - complete ownership and autonomy
Intense, hardworking culture of people who love to build

Mission

They're building a new category of adaptive, interactive entertainment- AI experiences that evolve as you engage.

Think beyond TikTok/YouTube: this is entertainment that responds in real time.

If this sounds like you, apply now.

This is a career-defining opportunity to build at the frontier of AI with one of the most exciting engineering teams in Australia.

A new opportunity is open for a Senior Algorithm Engineer to join a high-performance development team working on real-time RF and AI-based sensing systems. This role is ideal for an experienced engineer who enjoys turning advanced theory into practical solutions that operate at the edge.
¬†¬†
The role involves designing, integrating, and optimising complex algorithms to power intelligent sensor platforms deployed in operational environments. It requires deep collaboration with software engineers, systems designers, and UI developers to ensure algorithmic outputs are both efficient and actionable.

Key Responsibilities

Research and implement mathematical models and algorithms for deployment on edge computing platforms
Collaborate with software teams to optimise model integration within production architectures
Contribute to GUI discussions to ensure algorithmic outputs are user-friendly and visually intuitive
Manage data pipelines including multi-domain datasets, preparation, labelling, and validation
Maintain clean, well-documented codebases for sensor fusion and ML-driven software modules
Support decision-making across software and hardware teams for complex system evolution
Guide the integration of models into scalable, high-performance production environments
Skills and Experience Required

Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related technical field
Proven experience designing and integrating complex algorithms for sensor data or real-time systems
Familiarity with signal processing, time-series analysis, and sensor fusion techniques
Experience working with RF data or analysis tools is highly desirable
Strong grasp of probability, statistics, and their application in modelling
Competency with version control and Git workflows
Comfortable operating in Linux environments with modern toolchains
Desirable Attributes

Exposure to ML/AI workflows or model deployment practices
Familiarity with heterogeneous computing or GPU programming (CUDA)
Ability to turn business requirements into robust, interpretable algorithmic solutions
Strong communicator capable of bridging technical conversations across multidisciplinary teams
Passion for staying up to date with algorithmic advances and deploying real-world solutions
A hands-on mindset and motivation to contribute in a fast-paced, mission-driven environment
This is a unique opportunity to work at the intersection of advanced analytics, signal intelligence, and real-time systems, with tangible impact across defence, surveillance, and security domains.

For more info, feel free to contact me at farid@thedrivegroup.com.au or click Apply to send through your details and I'll be in touch.

We are oOh!media (pronounced ‚Äúoh!‚Äù media).¬†

oOh!media is the #1 Out of Home company in Australia and New Zealand.¬†¬†

We exist to make public spaces better and brands unmissable, proudly leading the market with innovation, creativity, data and results. Our network plays an important role in the communities they are located, creating engaging environments that inform, entertain and inspire, while connecting brands with audiences at scale.¬†¬†

We are oOh!media, and we are unmissable.

Join us:¬†¬†

We‚Äôre a team driven by creativity, innovation, and a sense of community. We show up every day ready to be bold, brave, and push the boundaries of Out of Home advertising. You‚Äôll work alongside a group of talented individuals across Australia and New Zealand, all of whom are dedicated to raising the bar. If you‚Äôre ready to realize your potential and make an impact, join us.¬†

About the opportunity:

¬†Permanent role
Based in North Sydney

We are seeking a hands-on AI Solutions Engineer to join our Engineering team and act as the technical builder responsible for turning AI hypotheses into secure, scalable prototypes and automations.

This role is the bridge across data, platform, and product domains, connecting systems, data, and intelligence. You will blend rapid experimentation with disciplined engineering, ensuring AI prototypes are built safely, run reliably, and can evolve into long-term industrial capabilities.

If you are a problem-solver and tinkerer who thrives on figuring out how to connect systems and automate workflows, this is your chance to make a massive impact.

Key responsibilities and experience:

Building Tactical AI Solutions: Translate user stories into working AI workflows, automations, and copilots. You will build and connect data pipelines, APIs, and low-code components across systems.
Prototyping & Experimentation: Safely experiment with emerging frameworks, including LLMs, Agentic systems, and RAG architectures.
Security & Governance: Apply responsible AI principles and ensure solutions comply with InfoSec and privacy standards.
Data Connectivity: Ensure secure and efficient data access (read, transform, integrate) across all solutions.

You will also have:

3‚Äì6 years in Data, Platform, or Automation Engineering.
Skilled in SQL, APIs, and low-code/no-code platforms (e.g., Power Automate, Logic Apps, Zapier).
Familiarity with Python/JavaScript for glue code and LLM integration.
Experience integrating SaaS tools (e.g., CRM, CMS, BI, Data Warehousing).
Experience with AWS, Azure, M365, and data governance standards.
Familiarity with RAG, Agentic systems, and MCP frameworks.
Detail-oriented, secure by design, and disciplined with data.
A fast learner who stays current with emerging AI tools and frameworks.
A natural collaborator comfortable partnering with non-technical peers.

Bonus: Experience with DataBricks is an advantage.




Our benefits and perks:

Competitive salary package¬†
A positive, supportive workplace culture¬†
Professional growth and development opportunities¬†
Comprehensive, paid training and ongoing support¬†

If you‚Äôre curious, ready for a unique challenge, and want to make a real impact, we want to hear from you!¬†

At oOh!, we celebrate diversity and strive for an inclusive environment. We welcome applications from all backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people with disabilities, LGBTQIA+ individuals, and refugees.¬†

To be considered, applicants must be Australian citizens or permanent residents with full working rights in Australia, and all offers of employment are subject to employer-funded pre-employment checks including police, reference, and work rights verification, with additional checks such as credit, bankruptcy, drug and alcohol screening, or driver‚Äôs licence verification required for some roles.

Company: Australian Institute of Health and Welfare
Ad Text:
The AIHW‚Äôs APS employee census results attest to our positive and supportive workplace culture. We are an inclusive, flexible, and productive workplace where people are treated with respect and courtesy, and diverse and unique attributes are recognised and valued. Our results also show that we achieved top ten rankings in staff engagement, communication, wellbeing and SES manager scales out of 107 APS agencies.

We offer a range of benefits including:

access to flexible working arrangements to support your work/life balance
attractive remuneration packages including generous superannuation and leave provisions
challenging and fulfilling work where you can use your skills and expertise
opportunities for professional development

We are committed to creating genuine opportunities for everyone and we welcome applications from First Nations people, people with disability, LGBTIQA+, neurodiverse people and people from diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds.¬†

For more information, visit the Benefits of working for the AIHW page of our website.

The data analytics engineer position focuses on improving the efficiency, reliability, and scalability of data collation processes by developing and maintaining tools and systems that streamline data ingestion, validation, transformation, and integration of data from eight jurisdictions to compile a national data set.¬†

Operating under limited supervision, you will lead technical workstreams, apply your engineering and analytical skills to solve complex data problems, and collaborate with internal stakeholders and jurisdictional data providers to ensure solutions are fit-for-purpose, secure, and aligned with national data standards.¬†

This role requires a balance of strong technical capabilities, project coordination skills, and the ability to work effectively with diverse stakeholders in a complex intergovernmental environment.

Under general direction you will:

Analyse existing data collation processes and identify opportunities for automation and improvement, for compiling a national data set from eight jurisdictional supplies (improve data flows, reduce manual effort, and automate key processes).
Design, develop, and maintain automated data pipelines and workflows to collect, validate, and integrate data from eight jurisdictional sources into a national system. The pipelines should be scalable, reliable, efficient, and aligned with relevant Institute wide initiatives (see last point).
Implement robust data validation, transformation, and quality assurance procedures using engineering and programming best practices.
Collaborate with data providers and internal stakeholders (including analysts and ICT) to define and document technical requirements, data standards, and business rules.
Provide advice, technical support (including user guides), and training to uplift staff capability in modern data workflows.
Document processes and promote reusable solutions to ensure sustainability and efficiency across the Institute.
Provide expert advice and support Institute wide process optimisation, automation and analytics environment modernisation initiatives.

How to apply

Please submit your application online via the AIHW e-Recruit system using this link. When applying online for the first time, you will need to register and provide a valid email address.

Your application must include:

A summary of your relevant skills and experience and explain why you would be the best person for
the role. Your response should align with the position summary and selection criteria information above, and must be no more than 750 words.
Your current CV and the names of two referees

About us:

At Lockheed Martin Australia, we believe that when people are empowered, inspired, and supported, they can achieve extraordinary things. We embrace flexibility, so our people can be their best inside and outside of work. We champion inclusion and continuous learning, ensuring all voices are heard and valued. And we thrive on collaboration, turning challenges into opportunities for growth and innovation. About the job
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google‚Äôs needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.Google Photos is a photo sharing and storage service developed by Google. Photos is one of the most sought after products at Google and is looking for both client-side (web and mobile), with server-side (search, storage, serving) and machine intelligence (learning, computer vision) Software Engineers. We are dedicated to making Google experiences centered around the user.
